meanings.definition: Capable of being rated or evaluated.
meanings.sent1: The movie was very ratable, as it received high scores from all the critics.
meanings.sent2: The new book is quite ratable, with its engaging plot and well-developed characters.
meanings.sent3: The cake's taste was so ratable that it received a perfect score from the judges.
meanings.sent4: Her performance in the play was ratable like a shining star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The painting's beauty was so ratable that it left everyone in awe.

meanings.sent1: The property's ratable value determined the amount of tax owed by the owner.
meanings.sent2: Businesses must report all ratable income to ensure proper tax compliance.
meanings.sent3: The ratable goods in the store attracted the attention of the tax collectors.
meanings.sent4: His ratable assets made him a target for the tax authorities.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the ratable deductions can help reduce your tax burden.

meanings.definition: Able to be classified or ranked.
meanings.sent1: The students' ratable performances in the exam helped the teacher assess their understanding.
meanings.sent2: The athletes' skills were easily ratable based on their performance in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The ratable books on the shelf were arranged according to their genres.
meanings.sent4: Her ratable achievements in the field of science earned her recognition worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The cars were ratable by their speed and fuel efficiency.
